017package org.apache.commons.chain.config;
018
019import java.net.URL;
020
021import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
022import org.apache.commons.digester.Digester;
023import org.apache.commons.digester.RuleSet;
024
025/**
026 * Class to parse the contents of an XML configuration file (using
027 * Commons Digester) that defines and configures commands and command chains
028 * to be registered in a {@link Catalog}. Advanced users can configure the
029 * detailed parsing behavior by configuring the properties of an instance
030 * of this class prior to calling the {@code parse()} method. It
031 * is legal to call the {@code parse()} method more than once, in order
032 * to parse more than one configuration document.
033 *
034 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
035 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
036 */
037public class ConfigParser {
038
039    // ----------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
040
041    /**
042     * The {@code Digester} to be used for parsing.
043     */
044    private Digester digester = null;
045
046    /**
047     * The {@code RuleSet} to be used for configuring our Digester
048     * parsing rules.
049     */
050    private RuleSet ruleSet = null;
051
052    /**
053     * Should Digester use the context class loader?
054     */
055    private boolean useContextClassLoader = true;
056
057    // ------------------------------------------------------------- Properties
058
059    /**
060     * Return the {@code Digester} instance to be used for
061     * parsing, creating one if necessary.
062     *
063     * @return A Digester instance.
064     */
065    public Digester getDigester() {
066        if (digester == null) {
067            digester = new Digester();
068            RuleSet ruleSet = getRuleSet();
069            digester.setNamespaceAware(ruleSet.getNamespaceURI() != null);
070            digester.setUseContextClassLoader(getUseContextClassLoader());
071            digester.setValidating(false);
072            digester.addRuleSet(ruleSet);
073        }
074        return digester;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Return the {@code RuleSet} to be used for configuring
079     * our {@code Digester} parsing rules, creating one if necessary.
080     *
081     * @return The RuleSet for configuring a Digester instance.
082     */
083    public RuleSet getRuleSet() {
084        if (ruleSet == null) {
085            ruleSet = new ConfigRuleSet();
086        }
087        return ruleSet;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Set the {@code RuleSet} to be used for configuring
092     * our {@code Digester} parsing rules.
093     *
094     * @param ruleSet The new RuleSet to use
095     */
096    public void setRuleSet(RuleSet ruleSet) {
097        this.digester = null;
098        this.ruleSet = ruleSet;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Return the "use context class loader" flag. If set to
103     * {@code true}, Digester will attempt to instantiate new
104     * command and chain instances from the context class loader.
105     *
106     * @return {@code true} if Digester should use the context class loader.
107     */
108    public boolean getUseContextClassLoader() {
109        return this.useContextClassLoader;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Set the "use context class loader" flag.
114     *
115     * @param useContextClassLoader The new flag value
116     */
117    public void setUseContextClassLoader(boolean useContextClassLoader) {
118        this.useContextClassLoader = useContextClassLoader;
119    }
120
121    // --------------------------------------------------------- Public Methods
122
123    /**
124     * Parse the XML document at the specified URL, using the configured
125     * {@code RuleSet}, registering top level commands into the specified
126     * {@link Catalog}. Use this method <strong>only</strong> if you have
127     * <strong>NOT</strong> included any {@code factory} element in your
128     * configuration resource, and wish to supply the catalog explicitly.
129     *
130     * @param catalog {@link Catalog} into which configured chains are
131     *        to be registered
132     * @param url {@code URL} of the XML document to be parsed
133     *
134     * @throws Exception if a parsing error occurs
135     *
136     * @deprecated Use parse(URL) on a configuration resource with "factory"
137     *  element(s) embedded
138     */
139    @Deprecated
140    public void parse(Catalog<?> catalog, URL url) throws Exception {
141        // Prepare our Digester instance
142        Digester digester = getDigester();
143        digester.clear();
144        digester.push(catalog);
145
146        // Parse the configuration document
147        digester.parse(url);
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Parse the XML document at the specified URL using the configured
152     * {@code RuleSet}, registering catalogs with nested chains and
153     * commands as they are encountered. Use this method <strong>only</strong>
154     * if you have included one or more {@code factory} elements in your
155     * configuration resource.
156     *
157     * @param url {@code URL} of the XML document to be parsed
158     *
159     * @throws Exception if a parsing error occurs
160     */
161    public void parse(URL url) throws Exception {
162        // Prepare our Digester instance
163        Digester digester = getDigester();
164        digester.clear();
165
166        // Parse the configuration document
167        digester.parse(url);
168    }
169}
